newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS SOFTER ON SLIGHT PRESSURE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS SOFTER ON SLIGHT PRESSURE.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed weaker against the key U.S. currency on Tuesday on the back of slight import pressure after a week-long appreciative streak, dealers said.

"Nothing much happened, the day was a really quiet one. We closed half a cent easier but we can't say there were lots of payments. I think people were basically trying to protect their positions," one dealer commented.

The local currency finished the day at 10.5600/5800 against the U.S. unit, down from Monday's 10.5575/5775 and was also weaker against pound sterling at 17.4390/4820 compared to 17.2950/3390, tracking sterling's strength overseas.
It edged up to 6.9730/9890 from 6.9740/9920 against the mark but was stable against South Africa's rand at 2.2450/2530.
